post.body:
So, about a few days ago, I received a message from YouTube about a claim that had been made on my video.

"Hi FB3 Network,

A copyright owner using Content ID has claimed some material in your video.

Your video is live and the visibility settings you selected remain applied to it. But it is now either being monetized by the copyright owner, or they have chosen to receive analytics about it.

This is not a copyright strike. This claim does not affect your account status.

Video title: Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase
Copyrighted content: Do You Don't You
Claimed by: License.Monstercat.com"

2 days ago, I filed a dispute against this claim because the audio was used for less than 30 seconds and the music plays before every race, so I went ahead and filed my dispute.
	
"Hi FB3 Network,

The following claim on video Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase has been disputed:

Video title: Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase
Copyrighted content: Do You Don't You
Claimed by: License.Monstercat.com

Reason for dispute: Approval from copyright holder is not required. It is fair use under copyright law."

And today, I got a email from YouTube about 30 - 40 minutes ago. It was a really, really good and surprising email. Something I always dreamt of happening.

"Hi FB3 Network,

Good news! After reviewing your dispute, License.Monstercat.com has decided to release their copyright claim on your YouTube video.

Video title: "Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase"

- The YouTube Team"

I ACTUALLY CAN'T BELIEVE I ACTUALLY WON A DISPUTE!!!

"Hi FB3 Network,

A copyright owner using Content ID has claimed some material in your video.

Your video is live and the visibility settings you selected remain applied to it. But it is now either being monetized by the copyright owner, or they have chosen to receive analytics about it.

This is not a copyright strike. This claim does not affect your account status.

Video title: Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase Copyrighted content: Do You Don't You Claimed by: License.Monstercat.com"

2 days ago, I filed a dispute against this claim because the audio was used for less than 30 seconds and the music plays before every race, so I went ahead and filed my dispute.

"Hi FB3 Network,

The following claim on video Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase has been disputed:

Video title: Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase Copyrighted content: Do You Don't You Claimed by: License.Monstercat.com

Reason for dispute: Approval from copyright holder is not required. It is fair use under copyright law."

And today, I got a email from YouTube about 30 - 40 minutes ago. It was a really, really good and surprising email. Something I always dreamt of happening.

"Hi FB3 Network,

Good news! After reviewing your dispute, License.Monstercat.com has decided to release their copyright claim on your YouTube video.

Video title: "Forza Horizon 4 - The Halo Experience Showcase"

  • The YouTube Team"

body:
> Sexual sins are the only kind of sins we're told to **flee** from (1 Corinthians) and there's probably a reason

That's an excuse someone came up with to do everything you want as long as it isn't *that*. Are you denying that you're supposed to flee from *all* evil? Furthermore, divorce and sexual objectification of others are usually tolerated and they definitely fall under that umbrella. And if it's so important why does Jesus barely mention it?

> I have just as much a problem with this as I have with my uncle who devoted his wife and married another woman.

Actions speak louder than words. I don't know what else *you* post but I see a heck of a lot of posts from people about this but never about divorce.

> I hate gluttony more than homosexuality, but it's not a sin that we're told to flee from. That's the difference.

You're basically saying, "we may do everything except what Paul said to flee from one time when he was addressing that specific issue". Paul didn't think that. Let's take a look at his logic here:

> 5:1It is actually reported that there is immorality among you, and immorality of such a kind as does not exist even among the Gentiles, that someone has his father’s wife. 2You have become arrogant and have not mourned instead, so that the one who had done this deed would be removed from your midst.
> 
> [6Your boasting is not good. Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump of dough? 7Clean out the old leaven so that you may be a new lump, just as you are in fact unleavened. For Christ our Passover also has been sacrificed. 8Therefore let us celebrate the feast, not with old leaven, nor with the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.]
> 
> 9I wrote you in my letter not to associate with immoral people; 10I did not at all mean with the immoral people of this world, or with the covetous and swindlers, or with idolaters, for then you would have to go out of the world. 11But actually, I wrote to you not to associate with anyone called a brother if he is an immoral person, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or a swindler—not even to eat with such a one. 13 Remove the wicked man from among yourselves.
> 
> [6:12All things are permitted for me, but not all things are of benefit. All things are permitted for me, but I will not be mastered by anything.] [13Food is for the stomach and the stomach is for food, however God will do away with both of them.] Now the body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord is for the body. 14Now God has not only raised the Lord, but will also raise us up through His power. 15Do you not know that your bodies are parts of Christ? Shall I then take away the parts of Christ and make them parts of a prostitute? Far from it! 16Or do you not know that the one who joins himself to a prostitute is one body with her? For He says, “The two will become one flesh.” 17But the one who joins himself to the Lord is one spirit with Him. 18Flee sexual immorality. Every other sin that a person commits is outside the body, but the sexually immoral person sins against his own body. 19Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God, and that you are not your own? 20For you have been bought for a price: therefore glorify God in your body.

Basically, the point being made by verses 18-20 is "Outsiders are seeing this and they're going to think this is what Christians do! And you are also tempting your brothers! Don't become associated with this!". He's not telling them *not* to worry about anything that isn't sexual. He's just trying to explain to them that they shouldn't commit adultery like that, because that's what they were doing. The bit about the body vs outside the body is just Paul giving them his explanation for what's wrong with it, because that part is somewhat unique about it. But he's not trying to put it in some special category of worse and unforgivable sin, nor would he be correct if he really did so.

body: You should probably withdraw from mainstream Christianity for the moment. Most of it only still stands so they can use God's name for a political cause, and they all promote it. And when everyone else is doing something it's really hard not to blindly follow along yourself. I guarantee you once this culture war is over "Christians" are going to drop like flies since they have no use for that identity anymore, and we'll see how many of them were even true believers at all or just using the label for identity politics. Most of them are really traditionalists and only choose Christianity because it has a high prominence in America's past, and they want to bring that back, not actually follow the faith. You can see this clearly by how "Christian values" have more to do with social norms of America's past than anything coming from the first century. Speaking of the first century, there was a similar situation then where the Jewish mainstream was becoming ultra-zealous and concerned only about winning against the "pagans" and thought the messiah was an ultra warrior who would come and win for them so they could enslave the whole world for themselves.

post.body:
Some Christians might have trouble with creationism or with the resurrection, but for me it's the Church. I just don't know anymore... 

A few months ago, my husband and I (both lifelong Protestants) started examining our faith when we realized that we decided we wanted our own home church. I knew that despite being Baptist/Nondenominational, I wanted something traditional and grounded, so we considered everything, including Catholic and Orthodox Christianity. The Episcopalian church our friends invited us to had a giant BLM display, an old lady pastor (which, sorry, I don't believe is biblical) and liturgy that was almost entirely written post-1970. We didn't even get through the doors of the Lutheran church with all of its Gay Pride/Hate Has No Home Here symbology around the front lawn. My husband and I have opposite experiences with Catholicism (I've known many incredible and inspiring Catholics, but he basically assumes its the anti-church), so that became a no-go. For a while, I was really excited about Orthodox Christianity, and we have a church only five minutes from our house. But the mask mandates made conversation almost impossible, and we were very confused about icons, and my husband decided it was all too weird for him.

In the end, he's doubling down on fundamentalism at present, while I'm increasingly questioning Protestantism as a whole. It's been almost ten years since I had a church. It was non-denominational, and while I liked it, it experienced a 3-way split in the end. Ugly stuff. I miss a church community. I'm puzzled when I read books like I Timothy and can't find anything matching the description... at least that we're both on board with. Sometimes I feel like it's never going to happen.

No, we haven't had any fights. We're both very understanding of each other's views. It's just frustrating that we keep siding differently. Prayers seriously appreciated!

TLDR: My husband and I can't agree on a denomination. The process is tiring, and I miss going to church!

It was non-denominational, and while I liked it, it experienced a 3-way split in the end. Ugly stuff. I miss a church community. I'm puzzled when I read books like I Timothy and can't find anything matching the description... at least that we're both on board with. Sometimes I feel like it's never going to happen.

No, we haven't had any fights. We're both very understanding of each other's views. It's just frustrating that we keep siding differently. Prayers seriously appreciated!

TLDR: My husband and I can't agree on a denomination. The process is tiring, and I miss going to church!
post.title: Prayer Request (with minor rant)

post.body:
"Nintendo" (which used to like his vids) apparently sent him a Cease and Desist letter demanding he stop using Nintendo references on his channels. Well apparently using the human puppets was not enough and now he said all his channels are being taken down June 1st 2021 which is tomorrow! I wish this was a joke but it's not, here's the proof! https://www.youtube.com/sml/community

I kind of wonder whether it was actually Nintendo or if it was really someone else trying to fake excuses to wipe out all remaining channels that aren't directly under the control of Google Inc. We know YouTube hates SML's guts, and in the past 2 years especially we've seen most of the old YouTubers quit (ExplodingTNT, PinkSheep), get rebranded by YouTube Inc. (SMG4), or get demonetized or terminated for no reason, to be replaced by completely obvious plants and hired YouTubers who instantly gain massive visibility with zero effort (Dream). Google probably knows SML is the last major remnant of pre-monetization YouTube, and while he too likes big bucks he's too stubborn to bend to their wishes all the time and won't make videos just to help them make more money. Everyone else who isn't part of the marketing scheme is either dead or buried below everything else and never sees the light of day, SML being one of the last survivors from the old days and they know it's not advertiser-friendly nor good for their desire to control everything like 1984.

post.body:
I was wondering what your thoughts are on churches that express resounding patriotism and hanging up symbols of a nation as opposed to church symbols.

This past memorial day, flags were lined in the parking lots and next to the pulpits and I just think of the misplaced expression of memorializing fallen soldiers.  It's the nation that is at fault for our young men dying. They died because of political and economic interests of our elites... led astray by the propaganda and lies by the government.  It's ironic to hold up national flags in remembrance of the fallen. It's satanic to fly a government symbol in church - especially in glory of war.
